page.title: 04WESTMANCOTE ON BREDON HILL
page.content: Westmancote is a pretty little village in the country.It has got many foot- paths which lead to lots of exciting places.Westmancote is a very quiet village with{no school no post office {and no shops,}but in the middle of the village it has got a little chapel. Just up the road there is a Riding Stable.A Man called John Hagley owns it. Some of the children in our class go riding there. Some of the houses are made out of Costwold Stone but we have seen lots of red brick houses in one little road.There are lots of orchards in Westmancote.The houses in the village are expensive because many are big.Those made out of Cotswold Stone are very expensive.If you walk to the top of the village there is a very interesting , large, disused quarry.
